    • Method Detail

      • isContradictoryBranch

        public boolean isContradictoryBranch()
        Determines if this tree node leads to a contradiction. Every path from this tree node must lead to a contradiction including all of its children
        Specified by:
        isContradictoryBranch in class TreeElement
        Returns:
        true if this tree node leads to a contradiction, false otherwise

      • isValidBranch

        public boolean isValidBranch()
        Recursively determines if the sub tree rooted at this tree puzzleElement is valid by checking whether this tree puzzleElement and all descendants of this tree puzzleElement is justified and justified correctly
        Specified by:
        isValidBranch in class TreeElement
        Returns:
        true if this tree puzzleElement and all descendants of this tree puzzleElement is valid, false otherwise

      • getAncestors

        public java.util.List<TreeNode> getAncestors()

        Returns:

      • getDescendants

        public java.util.List<TreeElement> getDescendants()
        Gets a list of the descendants of this node
        Returns:
        list of all the descendants for this node

      • findMergingBranches

        public DisjointSets<TreeTransition> findMergingBranches()
        Gets a DisjointSets containing the children of this node such that the sets contained within the DisjointSets are such that elements in the same set are branches of this tree node that will eventually merge. This could mean that multiple merges take place before this happens.
        Returns:
        DisjointSets of tree transitions containing unique non-merging branches

      • findMergingPoint

        public static TreeTransition findMergingPoint(java.util.Set<? extends TreeElement> branches)
        Finds the point at which the set of tree elements passed in will merge. This must be a set gotten from findMergingBranches method DisjointSets
        Parameters:
        branches - tree elements to find the merging point
        Returns:
        tree transition of the merging point or null if no such point exists
